intro: Pleuranthodium neragaimae, commonly known as the Malay mountain orchid, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude forests of Borneo. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pale greenish-yellow flowers with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows on tree trunks or rocks, showcasing its epiphytic nature. Its leaves are narrow and strap-like, adapted to conserve moisture in its humid, shaded habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
